channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside number 12 Pirton lane, 4th April
item.description:
Large pothole formed. Outside 12 Pirton lane, getting bigger by the day. Also several other potholes along this road up near the bridge need repairing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 4th April
item.description:
Next to the car park of Hickory Dickory's nursery and parked on the street. This car has been parked here for two years and it now has vegetation growing around it which will be damaging the road. It doesn't have an MOT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Rodney Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on lefthand side of road, 4th April
item.description:
Just past the end of the 30mph area as you head along Hyde Lane from Cheltenham towards Southam.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole, 11 inches deep, in pavement, Foxwell Drive/Hillview Road junction, 4th April
item.description:
Hole, 11 inches deep, on pavement at junction of Foxwell Drive and Hillview Road. From comparison with Google Maps of 2012, the hole looks as though it is where a black bollard used to be. For anyone who is Severely Sight Impaired (Blind) or Sight Impaired (Partially Sighted) and who uses a walking stick, there is the possibility of the person not seeing the hole and their walking stick going down it. I am concerned that if a person's walking stick does goes down the hole, the person will have a nasty accident. Could someone fill the hole or fit a new bollard, please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxwell Drive, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: No metal cover on drain. Nothing to stop debris blocking drain. High risk of damage to car wheels, 4th April
item.description:
The drain with the missing metal cover is located: Outside number 23 Jasmin Way, Up Hatherley, Cheltenham, GL51 3HZ. It is on the road next to the bushes separating the road from the front garden of number 23.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Jasmin Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light sequence out and causing traffic jams, 4th April
item.description:
The traffic lights on the intersection of Hucclecote Road and Churchdown Lane/Carisbrooke Road is still causing major problems despite having originally been reported in February. There are now temporary traffic lights due to the Severn Trent works (disappointing given that the road has only just been resurfaced) but somehow these are only 3 way lights on a 4 way junction. Please could someone finally sort the traffic light sequencing out once the main lights are back up and running as this is causing traffic to back up from Top Shop on the corner of Churchdown Lane all the way down to the Wagon & Horses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Jasmin Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerously tall and overgrown trees - high risk of property damage in strong wind & rats, 4th April
item.description:
The garden of the 8 Daylesford Close is hideously overgrown by trees totally inappropriate for the back garden of a semi - detached house in an urban area. The trees are swaying to dangerous angles in high winds and it is only a matter of time before they land on someone - killing them or fall on neighbouring properties. The occupants are refusing to reduce their height and it is now too the point of obstructing daylight for many neighbouring properties, but especially us next door in number 10. Due to the mess and extreme overgrowth, their garden is infested with rats which they put food down for.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Daylesford Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
